title: Orzo with purple-sprouting broccoli
description: This pasta dish works well served hot or cold. Orzo has great texture and shape, plus it takes on flavours exceptionally well.
instructions: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large, shallow frying pan and cook the garlic and chilli until golden, about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside.
Cook the orzo according to the pack instructions. Meanwhile, separate the broccoli florets from the stalks, slicing any thick stalks.
Two minutes before the orzo is cooked, add the broccoli to the pan. When both are cooked, drain.
Return the pan with the chilli oil to the heat and tip in the cooked orzo and broccoli. Toss enthusiastically, taking care not to smash the florets.
Season, add the lemon zest, and tip into a large serving bowl. Crumble the ricotta over the top and drizzle with the remaining 1 tbsp olive oil.
imageDesc: An oval plate with a mound of orzo pasta mixed through with small broccoli shoots and ricotta cheese.
